column2: Although  young, these line  infantry are fairly well-armoured and can be expected to fight well.
Tough, heavily armed and armoured Italian elite infantry who are very useful in close combat.
With five rowers powering each set of three oars, the quinquireme is a powerful, swift warship.
Iron-prowed, with three banks of oars, the trireme is the mainstay of all civilized navies.
Velites harass and disrupt enemy formations with massed spear volleys.
Older, experienced Romans fight as close-order infantry armed with throwing pila and swords.
Trained to fight in the Roman style, these soldiers have both effective missile and melee attacks.
These cavalrymen can harry and pursue enemy forces, and quickly move to exploit opportunities.
